featured.text: Follow the closely, and you will find it easy to assemble the bicycle.
Our reaction to pain is closely related to our expectation of pain.
We closely followed the advice in your article.
Built under the sea in 1994, the _____ between England and France connects the UK more closely with mainland Europe.
The sea snakes’ population distribution is closely related to rainfall.

definition.en_def: In a way that is near in distance or relationship; with careful attention.
definition.example: She examined the painting closely to notice all the details.
